 Human society is a system, of communication. communication requires feedback. Crying is just one of many forms of feedback.
 
 Crying let's others:
 1. Know you are in emotional distress
 2. Compels others to comfort you (attention, pain alleviation, etc.)
 
 If my wife cries, I respond. Is it a conscious response? In part, but that's probably my rational brain rationalizing my compulsion to comfort her and stop the crying (by helping in some way).
 
 As to why some women also enjoy TV shows like this...from what I understand emotional distress is a "high" of sorts. Some men like it too, but I think we all know, despite PC nonsense, that men do not seem to, on average, have the same emotional range of women. Rage/anger are the man's speciality (no surprise testosterone also increases this). 
 
 -Mach
